metadata.usage:
Adaptive Poisson-Boltzmann Solver (APBS) is a software package for the numerical solution of the Poisson-Boltzmann equation (PBE), one of the most popular continuum models for describing electrostatic interactions between molecular solutes in salty, aqueous media.
Tutorial: http://www.nbcr.net/ws_help/APBS_PARALLEL
apbs version: 1.2.1
metadata.info:
apbs [options] apbs.in
where apbs.in is a formatted input file and [options] are:
--output-file=<name> Enables output logging to the path listed in <name>. Uses flat-file format is --output-format is not used. --output-format=<type> Specifies format for logging. Options for type are either "xml" or "flat". --procs Number of processors to be used. --help Display this help information. --version Display the current APBS version.
